pullRequest.body:
This specializes the existing `Finset.prod_ite_mem`.

From LeanAPAP

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ prod_ite_mem`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
```

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10983389298/job/30492706151)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10983389298/job/30492706318)

```suggestion
lemma prod_ite_mem (s : Finset Î¹) (f : Î¹ â Î±) : â i, if i â s then f i else 1 = â i â s, f i := by
```
or not?
No, doesn't work. `if then else` has very low precedence
What was this referring to before?
(at a glance, this looks like a duplicate lemma which has a bad name?)
The new one is `Fintype.`, the old one is `Finset.`, and so with both Fintype and Finset open `sum_ite_mem` becomes ambiguous
Thanks, edited the description to make this clearer.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `Fintype.prod_ite_mem`
